title.rendered: Texas Furnace Cleaning Service Near Me: 5 Signs Your Furnace Needs Cleaning

content.rendered:
People often think that since Texas is almost always hot, we don’t need furnaces or fireplaces here. But the local homeowners know that the nights get pretty here cold in November and December. And just imagine, it’s December, and you wake up in the middle of the night because your home is freezing cold. Your thermostat reads 54 degrees – that’s bad. You can’t call the furnace repair technician until morning – that’s worse! If you don’t want a similar scenario playing out in your life, it’s time to schedule an appointment with a furnace cleaning service near me.

A neglected furnace can break down at any moment, and cause a lot of headaches for you and your family. Not sure whether you need to call a furnace cleaning service near me yet? Here are a few signs that indicate your furnace desperately needs some TLC.

5 Reasons To Call A Furnace Cleaning Service Near Me 

Your Furnace Is Producing No Heat

Let’s start with the most obvious sign. If the furnace is not generating any heat, there could be an issue with the filter or the heat exchanger. The filters inside the furnace trap a lot of dirt and dust over time, becoming clogged. This can prevent the furnace from maintaining airflow. It could also be an overly-heated heat exchanger that may have shut off before warming up your house. Only an expert “furnace cleaning service near me” can diagnose the issue and handle it effectively.  

Weird Odors

A faint smell of burnt fuel is normal with oil and gas furnaces. However, if the smell is too strong and overwhelming in rooms that are closer to the furnace, call a furnace cleaning service “near me” right away.  When you turn on your furnace and the smell of sulfur or rotten egg soon follows, it could be due to a natural gas leak in your home. And if you notice an electrical or metallic smell after turning on the furnace, it could be due to the overheating or burning of the inside components of the unit.

Regardless of what type of odor it is, simply turn off the furnace immediately and call a furnace cleaning company as soon as possible. This is a very serious concern and can result in devastating consequences if not addressed right away.

Unexpectedly High Energy Bills

If you notice that you get significantly higher energy bills in the months when you use your furnace, it’s highly likely that the unit is not functioning at its peak efficiency. Maybe your furnace has become too old, or maybe some of its components need to be replaced.

Carbon Monoxide Detector Goes Off

If your carbon monoxide detector goes off soon after turning on the furnace, switch the unit off, and call a furnace technician immediately. Inhaling too much of this gas can be lethal. In fact, we recommend you shut off all the gas appliances in your home and open the windows. Also, call the fire department before you call a furnace repair expert.

Furnace Keeps Breaking Down

If you’ve repaired your furnace more than once in the last 2 years, it’s a sure-shot sign that the unit needs to be tuned up thoroughly. This is especially true if your furnace is over 10 years old. Call a furnace cleaning service near me and schedule an inspection before peak winter arrives.

Schedule Furnace Inspection And Maintenance Today

United Home Services can handle all your furnace inspection, cleaning, replacement, and repair needs. In addition to inspecting your furnace, we will also check out the rest of your heating system, including the electrical wiring and ductwork. This is to ensure your furnace breaks down seemingly out of nowhere and leaves you with no heat in the middle of the winter. Call us at 866-847-7454 or contact us online to schedule your appointment.
